```{r trainers}
trainers <- data.frame(
  name   = c("Sergio Ozoria Ramirez", "Maria Beg", "Eman Ibrahim", "Spencer Riddell"),
  github = c("smo2147",               "mb5357",    "ei2291",       "swr2118"),
  avatar = c(
    "https://github.com/smo2147.png?size=360",
    "https://github.com/mb5357.png?size=360",
    "https://github.com/ei2291.png?size=360",
    "https://github.com/swr2118.png?size=360"
  ),
  bio = c(
    "Add a short bio here (background, interests, role on the project).",
    "Add a short bio here (background, interests, role on the project).",
    "Add a short bio here (background, interests, role on the project).",
    "Add a short bio here (background, interests, role on the project)."
  ),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

card_for <- function(name, github, avatar, bio) {
  tags$div(
    class = "trainer-card trainer-card--horiz",
    tags$a(
      href   = paste0("https://github.com/", github),
      target = "_blank", rel = "noopener",
      tags$img(src = avatar, alt = name)
    ),
    tags$div(
      class = "trainer-card__body",
      tags$h3(class = "trainer-card__name", name),
      tags$p(
        tags$a(
          href   = paste0("https://github.com/", github),
          target = "_blank", rel = "noopener",
          paste0("github.com/", github)
        )
      ),
      tags$p(tags$em("Bio:"), " ", bio)
    )
  )
}

cards <- lapply(seq_len(nrow(trainers)), function(i) {
  x <- trainers[i, , drop = FALSE]
  card_for(x$name, x$github, x$avatar, x$bio)
})

hero <- tags$div(
  class = "hero",
  tags$h1("Meet the Trainers"),
  tags$p(style = "margin: 0.5rem 0 0;", "The team behind Gotta Graph â€™Em All")
)

page <- tagList(
  hero,
  tags$div(class = "trainer-grid", do.call(tagList, cards))
)

# Return the tag object (htmltools will render it properly)
page
```
